data.chText: 承认
data.enText: admit

data.chText: 承认（属实）
data.enText: to accept that sth is true

data.chText: 她拒不承认改革的必要性。
data.enText: She refuses to acknowledge the need for reform.

data.chText: 公认的事实
data.enText: a generally acknowledged fact

data.chText: 我没有承认他犯了什么错。
data.enText: I did not acknowledge that he had done anything wrong.

data.chText: 普遍认为那是真的。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: It is generally acknowledged to be true.

data.chText: 承认地位
data.enText: accept status

data.chText: 承认（权威、地位）
data.enText: to accept that sb/sth has a particular authority or status

data.chText: 这个国家承认了他继承王位的权利。
data.enText: The country acknowledged his claim to the throne.

data.chText: 普遍认为他是世界最佳球员。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He is widely acknowledged as the best player in the world.

data.chText: 普遍认为他是世界最佳球员。
data.enText: He is widely acknowledged to be the best player in the world.

data.chText: 复信
data.enText: reply to letter

data.chText: 告知收悉
data.enText: to tell sb that you have received sth that they sent to you

data.chText: 所有的申请都将得到复函告知收悉。
data.enText: All applications will be acknowledged.

data.chText: 信收到后请复函告知。
data.enText: Please acknowledge receipt of this letter.

data.chText: 微笑；挥手
data.enText: smile/wave

data.chText: （微笑、挥手等）致意
data.enText: to show that you have noticed sb/sth by smiling, waving, etc.

data.chText: 我就站在她身边，可是她理都不理我。
data.enText: I was standing right next to her, but she didn't even acknowledge me.

data.chText: 表示感谢
data.enText: express thanks

data.chText: （公开）感谢
data.enText: to publicly express thanks for help you have been given

data.chText: 我对本地几家企业的资助表示感谢。
data.enText: I gratefully acknowledge financial support from several local businesses.

data.text: admit ♦ acknowledge ♦ concede ♦ confess ♦ allow ♦ grant

data.chText: 以上各词均含承认之义，常指不情愿地承认某事属实。
data.enText: These words all mean to agree, often unwillingly, that sth is true.
admit

data.chText: 指承认（常指不情愿地承认某事属实）：
data.enText: to agree, often unwillingly, that sth is true

data.chText: 我承认，那次干的是件蠢事。
data.enText: It was a stupid thing to do, I admit.
acknowledge

data.chText: 指承认某事物存在或属实：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to accept that sth exists, is true or has happened

data.chText: 她拒不承认改革的必要性。
data.enText: She refuses to acknowledge the need for reform.
concede

data.chText: 指承认（常指不情愿地承认某事属实或合乎逻辑）：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to admit, often unwillingly, that sth is true or logical

data.chText: 他被迫承认可能有困难。
data.enText: He was forced to concede (that) there might be difficulties.

data.chText: 用admit还是concede？
admit通常指承认普遍认为不好或错误的事情属实或确实发生过，尤指与自己行为有关。concede通常指勉强承认某事属实或某种说法合乎逻辑。
data.enText: When sb admits sth, they are usually agreeing that sth which is generally considered bad or wrong is true or has happened, especially when it relates to their own actions. When sb concedes sth, they are usually accepting, unwillingly, that a particular fact or statement is true or logical.
admit or concede?
confess

data.chText: 指承认自己感到羞愧或尴尬的事：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to admit sth that you feel ashamed or embarrassed about

data.chText: 她不愿意承认自己无知。
data.enText: She was reluctant to confess her ignorance.
allow

data.chText: 指同意某事属实或正确：
data.enText: ( formal ) to agree that sth is true or correct

data.chText: 他拒不承认这种情况有可能发生。
data.enText: He refuses to allow that such a situation could arise.
grant

data.chText: 指同意某种说法属实，但通常同时否认另一过头说法：
data.enText: to admit that a statement or claim is true, usually while denying that a greater claim is also true

data.chText: 我同意，她是一个很聪明的女人，但并不是天才。
data.enText: She's an intelligent woman, I grant you, but she's no genius.

data.chText: 的确，他是个初学者，但基本规则他应该懂啊。
data.enText: Granted, he is a beginner, but he should know the basic rules.
to admit/acknowledge/concede/confess/allow/grant that…
to admit/confess to sth
to admit/concede/confess sth to sb
you must admit/acknowledge/concede/confess/allow/grant sth
to hate to admit/confess sth
to admit/acknowledge the truth
to admit/confess your mistakes/ignorance

ex.chText: 盗贼承认偷了这家商店的钱。
ex.enText: The thief admitted having stolen money from the shop.

ex.chText: 他承认自己或许有点儿紧张。
ex.enText: He admitted that he might be a little bit nervous.

synonyms.bx: 指承认过错，尤为罪行，或勉强承认某种情况。

ex.chText: 只有少数人承认改革的必要性。
ex.enText: Only a few acknowledge the need for reform.

ex.chText: 他被公认为当地最好的律师。
ex.enText: He was widely acknowledged to be the best lawyer in the neighbourhood.

ex.chText: 我们承认他是我们的新教练。
ex.enText: We acknowledged him as our new coach.

synonyms.bx: 指承认某一情况属实或接纳某种权威性。

ex.chText: 他承认自己犯了一些错误。
ex.enText: He conceded that he had made some errors.
They were finally forced to concede.
We conceded defeat in the election.

synonyms.bx: 指不情愿地承认某种事实，或不得不承认失败。

ex.chText: 她承认自己不太会做饭。
ex.enText: She confessed that she didn't really know how to cook.

synonyms.bx: 尤指承认使自己略显尴尬的事情，也指向警方坦白、供认罪行。

ex.chText: 该嫌疑人仍然声称自己无辜。
ex.enText: The suspect still professed his innocence.

ex.chText: 她表明了自己对他的爱。
ex.enText: She professed her love for him.

synonyms.bx: 通常指公开表明自己的感情、看法等。

tr: accept (someone) to be what is claimed or accept his power and authority
example: The Crown Prince was acknowledged as the true heir to the throne
We do not recognize your gods

tr: accept as legally binding and valid
declare to be true or admit the existence or reality or truth of
example: She acknowledged that she might have forgotten

tr: express obligation, thanks, or gratitude for
example: We must acknowledge the kindness she showed towards us
The program committee acknowledged the submission of the authors of the paper

tr: express recognition of the presence or existence of, or acquaintance with
example: He never acknowledges his colleagues when they run into him in the hallway
She acknowledged his complement with a smile
it is important to acknowledge the work of others in one's own writing

value.def: If you acknowledge a fact or a situation, you accept or admit that it is true or that it exists.

example.ex: Naylor acknowledged, in a letter to the judge, that he was a drug addict...
example.tran: 内勒在给法官的信中承认自己吸毒。

example.ex: Belatedly, the government has acknowledged the problem...
example.tran: 政府迟迟才承认了该问题。

example.ex: There is an acknowledged risk of lung cancer from radon.
example.tran: 氡被认为有诱发肺癌的危险。

gramarinfo.label: Also V n to-inf, V n <l>as</l> n/adj

value.def: If someone's achievements, status, or qualities are acknowledged, they are known about and recognized by a lot of people, or by a particular group of people.

example.ex: He is also acknowledged as an excellent goalkeeper...
example.tran: 他也被公认为是一名出色的守门员。

example.ex: Some of the clergy refused to acknowledge the new king's legitimacy.
example.tran: 一部分神职人员拒绝承认新国王的合法地位。

value.tran: 公认，认可（某人的成就、地位、品质等）

value.def: If you acknowledge a message or letter, you write to the person who sent it in order to say that you have received it.

example.ex: The army sent me a postcard acknowledging my request.
example.tran: 军队寄给我一张明信片告知我的申请书已收到。

value.tran: 告知（信函等）的收到;确认…收悉

value.def: If you acknowledge someone, for example by moving your head or smiling, you show that you have seen and recognized them.

example.ex: He saw her but refused to even acknowledge her.
example.tran: 他看见了她，却连招呼也不打。

value.tran: （以点头、微笑等）向…打招呼，理会

value.def: If you acknowledge someone's applause, compliments, or kindness you make a gesture in order to thank them or show your appreciation.

example.ex: Doran stuck his head out of the window to acknowledge the cheering...
example.tran: 多兰将头探出窗户向欢呼的人们致谢。

example.ex: She never even acknowledged the man who opened the door for her...
example.tran: 她对为自己开门的男士甚至连一点表示都没有。

example.ex: He acknowledged the applause with a small bow.
example.tran: 他微微地鞠了一躬表示对掌声的感谢。

value.tran: （对掌声、赞扬、好意等作出姿态表示）感谢
